intro: Ourouparia gambir, commonly known as gambir, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its most notable feature is the latex sap, which is used in the production of natural gum and has various traditional applications. The plant thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments.
